project.name: Shifty
project.description: A teeny tiny tweening engine in JavaScript.

Tweenable.token.name: Tweenable.token

params.name: opt_initialState
params.description:
The values that the initial tween should
start at if a `from` object is not provided to `{{#crossLink
"Tweenable/tween:method"}}{{/crossLink}}` or `{{#crossLink
"Tweenable/setConfig:method"}}{{/crossLink}}`.

params.name: opt_config
params.description:
Configuration object to be passed to
`{{#crossLink "Tweenable/setConfig:method"}}{{/crossLink}}`.

classitems.description:
Shifty Core
By Jeremy Kahn - jeremyckahn@gmail.com

Handy shortcut for doing a for-in loop. This is not a "normal" each
function, it is optimized for Shifty.  The iterator function only receives
the property name, not the value.
Perform a shallow copy of Object properties.

params.name: targetObject
params.description: The object to copy into

params.name: srcObject
params.description: The object to copy from

return.description: A reference to the augmented `targetObj` Object

classitems.description:
Copies each property from src onto target, but only if the property to
copy to target is undefined.

params.name: target
params.description: Missing properties in this Object are filled in

classitems.description:
Calculates the interpolated tween values of an Object for a given
timestamp.

params.name: forPosition
params.description: The position to compute the state for.

params.name: currentState
params.description: Current state properties.

params.name: originalState:
params.description:
The original state properties the Object is
tweening from.

params.name: targetState:
params.description:
The destination state properties the Object
is tweening to.

params.name: duration:
params.description: The length of the tween in milliseconds.

params.name: timestamp:
params.description: The UNIX epoch time at which the tween began.

params.name: easing:
params.description:
This Object's keys must correspond to the keys in
targetState.

classitems.description: Tweens a single property.

params.name: start
params.description: The value that the tween started from.

params.name: end
params.description: The value that the tween should end at.

params.name: easingFunc
params.description: The easing curve to apply to the tween.

params.name: position
params.description:
The normalized position (between 0.0 and 1.0) to
calculate the midpoint of 'start' and 'end' against.

classitems.description: Applies a filter to Tweenable instance.

params.name: tweenable
params.description:
The `Tweenable` instance to call the filter
upon.

params.name: filterName
params.description: The name of the filter to apply.

classitems.description: Handles the update logic for one step of a tween.

params.description: schedule

params.name: opt_currentTimeOverride
params.description:
Needed for accurate timestamp in
Tweenable#seek.

classitems.description:
Creates a usable easing Object from a string, a function or another easing
Object.  If `easing` is an Object, then this function clones it and fills
in the missing properties with `"linear"`.
Configure and start a tween.
classitems.name: tween

params.name: opt_config
params.description:
Configuration object to be passed to
`{{#crossLink "Tweenable/setConfig:method"}}{{/crossLink}}`.

classitems.description: Configure a tween that will start at some point in the future.
classitems.name: setConfig

params.name: config
params.description:
The following values are valid:
- __from__ (_Object=_): Starting position.  If omitted, `{{#crossLink
  "Tweenable/get:method"}}get(){{/crossLink}}` is used.
- __to__ (_Object=_): Ending position.
- __duration__ (_number=_): How many milliseconds to animate for.
- __delay__ (_delay=_): How many milliseconds to wait before starting the
  tween.
- __start__ (_Function(Object, *)_): Function to execute when the tween
  begins.  Receives the state of the tween as the first parameter and
  `attachment` as the second parameter.
- __step__ (_Function(Object, *, number)_): Function to execute on every
  tick.  Receives `{{#crossLink
  "Tweenable/get:method"}}get(){{/crossLink}}` as the first parameter,
  `attachment` as the second parameter, and the time elapsed since the
  start of the tween as the third. This function is not called on the
  final step of the animation, but `finish` is.
- __finish__ (_Function(Object, *)_): Function to execute upon tween
  completion.  Receives the state of the tween as the first parameter and
  `attachment` as the second parameter.
- __easing__ (_Object.<string|Function>|string|Function=_): Easing curve
  name(s) or function(s) to use for the tween.
- __attachment__ (_*_): Cached value that is passed to the
  `step`/`start`/`finish` methods.

params.name: state
params.description: The current state.

classitems.description:
Pause a tween.  Paused tweens can be resumed from the point at which they
were paused.  This is different from `{{#crossLink
"Tweenable/stop:method"}}{{/crossLink}}`, as that method
causes a tween to start over when it is resumed.
classitems.name: pause

classitems.description: Resume a paused tween.
classitems.name: resume

classitems.description:
Move the state of the animation to a specific point in the tween's
timeline.  If the animation is not running, this will cause the `step`
handlers to be called.
classitems.name: seek

params.name: millisecond
params.description:
The millisecond of the animation to seek
to.  This must not be less than `0`.

classitems.description: Stops and cancels a tween.

params.name: gotoEnd
params.description:
If `false` or omitted, the tween just stops at
its current state, and the `finish` handler is not invoked.  If `true`,
the tweened object's values are instantly set to the target values, and
`finish` is invoked.

classitems.name: stop

return.description: Whether or not a tween is running.

classitems.description:
Set a custom schedule function.

If a custom function is not set,
[`requestAnimationFrame`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/window.requestAnimationFrame)
is used if available, otherwise
[`setTimeout`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Window.setTimeout)
is used.
classitems.name: setScheduleFunction

params.name: scheduleFunction
params.description:
The function to be
used to schedule the next frame to be rendered.

classitems.description:
`delete` all "own" properties.  Call this when the `Tweenable` instance
is no longer needed to free memory.
classitems.name: dispose

classitems.description:
Filters are used for transforming the properties of a tween at various
points in a Tweenable's life cycle.  See the README for more info on this.

This object contains all of the tweens available to Shifty.  It is
extensible - simply attach properties to the `Tweenable.prototype.formula`
Object following the same format as `linear`.

`pos` should be a normalized `number` (between 0 and 1).
classitems.name: formula

classitems.description:
The Bezier magic in this file is adapted/copied almost wholesale from
[Scripty2](https://github.com/madrobby/scripty2/blob/master/src/effects/transitions/cubic-bezier.js),
which was adapted from Apple code (which probably came from
[here](http://opensource.apple.com/source/WebCore/WebCore-955.66/platform/graphics/UnitBezier.h)).
Special thanks to Apple and Thomas Fuchs for much of this code.

getCubicBezierTransition(x1, y1, x2, y2) -> Function

Generates a transition easing function that is compatible
with WebKit's CSS transitions `-webkit-transition-timing-function`
CSS property.

The W3C has more information about CSS3 transition timing functions:
http://www.w3.org/TR/css3-transitions/#transition-timing-function_tag

Create a Bezier easing function and attach it to `{{#crossLink
"Tweenable/formula:property"}}Tweenable#formula{{/crossLink}}`.  This
function gives you total control over the easing curve.  Matthew Lein's
[Ceaser](http://matthewlein.com/ceaser/) is a useful tool for visualizing
the curves you can make with this function.
classitems.name: setBezierFunction

params.name: name
params.description:
The name of the easing curve.  Overwrites the old
easing function on `{{#crossLink
"Tweenable/formula:property"}}Tweenable#formula{{/crossLink}}` if it
exists.

return.description:
The easing function that was attached to
Tweenable.prototype.formula.

classitems.description:
`delete` an easing function from `{{#crossLink
"Tweenable/formula:property"}}Tweenable#formula{{/crossLink}}`.  Be
careful with this method, as it `delete`s whatever easing formula matches
`name` (which means you can delete standard Shifty easing functions).
classitems.name: unsetBezierFunction

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the easing function to delete.

classitems.name: interpolate

params.name: from
params.description: The starting values to tween from.

params.name: targetState
params.description: The ending values to tween to.

params.name: position
params.description:
The normalized position value (between `0.0` and
`1.0`) to interpolate the values between `from` and `to` for.  `from`
represents `0` and `to` represents `1`.

params.name: easing
params.description:
The easing
curve(s) to calculate the midpoint against.  You can reference any easing
function attached to `Tweenable.prototype.formula`, or provide the easing
function(s) directly.  If omitted, this defaults to "linear".

params.name: opt_delay
params.description:
Optional delay to pad the beginning of the
interpolated tween with.  This increases the range of `position` from (`0`
through `1`) to (`0` through `1 + opt_delay`).  So, a delay of `0.5` would
increase all valid values of `position` to numbers between `0` and `1.5`.

classitems.description: Convert all hex color values within a string to an rgb string.

Convert a hexadecimal string to an array with three items, one each for
the red, blue, and green decimal values.

params.name: hex
params.description: A hexadecimal string.

return.description:
The converted Array of RGB values if `hex` is a
valid string, or an Array of three 0's.

classitems.description: Convert a base-16 number to base-10.

params.name: hex
params.description: The value to convert

classitems.description: Runs a filter operation on all chunks of a string that match a RegExp
Check for floating point values within rgb strings and rounds them.

return.description:
An Object of formatManifests that correspond to
the string properties of stateObject

classitems.description:
Note: It's the duty of the caller to convert the Array elements of the
return value into numbers.  This is a performance optimization.
